alert.note: Alert for Brantley; Glynn; Pierce; Wayne (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Jacksonville (Northeast Florida and Southeast Georgia)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued July 30 at 7:27PM EDT until July 30 at 8:00PM EDT by NWS Jacksonville
info.description: The National Weather Service in Jacksonville has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Northwestern Glynn County in southeastern Georgia... Eastern Pierce County in southeastern Georgia... Brantley County in southeastern Georgia... Wayne County in southeastern Georgia... * Until 800 PM EDT. * At 727 PM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Odum to near Raybon, moving southeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Jesup, Nahunta, Patterson, Gardi, Screven, Odum, Offerman, Hickox, Thalmann and Everett. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Large hail and damaging winds and continuous cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Move indoors immediately. Lightning is one of nature`s leading killers. Remember, if you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
